MARRIED. NEVIN - GRAFTON - On Thursday evening January 22, 1874 at the residence of the bride's parents, by the Rev. J.B. Bittinger, D.D.,

SEWICKLEY WEDDING. A very pleasant occasion was that of the wedding of Mr. Charles F. Nevin to Miss LIzzie Grafton, all of Sewickley, on Thursday evening last. The ceremony took place at the residence of the bride's father, Mr. Grafton, and a large number of invited guests were there to witness the rite and congratulate the handsome couple on their prospect for a long life of wedded happiness. The ceremony was performed by Dr. J.B. Bittinger, of the FIrst Presbyterian church of Sewickley. The usual joyful festivities followed, and with extorted admiration for the splendid display of presents, and the demolition of the good things provided, the evening sped away till "train time" summoned away the party and the guests from the city, and the suburban neighbors hied them home through a sea of mud, to talk over the event of the Sewickley season. Mr. Nevin and his bride started on a tour souithward, whither the kind wishes of all their friends follow them.
